standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Area of rectangles with fraction side lengths

question.content: Here is a rectangle:    **Find the area of the rectangle.**    $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled seven-eighths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled seven-eighths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled seven-eighths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters.

hints.content: The area of the rectangle is $\dfrac{21}{32} \text{ m}^2$.

question.content: Here is a rectangle:    **Find the area of the rectangle.**    $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled five-sixths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-third meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled five-sixths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-third meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled five-sixths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-third meters.

hints.content: The area of the rectangle is $\dfrac5{18}\text{m}^2$ .

question.content: Here is a rectangle:    **Find the area of the rectangle.**    $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled seven-eighths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled five-ninths meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled seven-eighths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled five-ninths meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled seven-eighths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled five-ninths meters.

hints.content: The area of the rectangle is $\dfrac{35}{72}\text{m}^2$.

question.content: Here is a rectangle:    **Find the area of the rectangle.**     $\text{cm}^2$

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-thirds centimeters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-thirds centimeters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-thirds centimeters.

hints.content: The area of the rectangle is $\dfrac43 \text{cm}^2$.  This can also be expressed as $1\dfrac13 \text{cm}^2$.

question.content: Here is a rectangle:    **Find the area of the rectangle.**    $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 1 and three-fourths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half meters.

hints.content: The ${\blueE{\text{length}}}$ is $\blueE{1\dfrac34}\text{ m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\blueE{1\dfrac34}$ as $\blueE{\dfrac74}$.

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 1 and three-fourths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 1 and three-fourths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half meters.

hints.content: The area of the rectangle is $\dfrac{7}{8} \text{m}^2$.

question.content: Here is a rectangle:    **Find the area of the rectangle.**    $\text{cm}^2$

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 4 centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two and a half centimeters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 4 centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two and a half centimeters.

hints.content: The ${\maroonD{\text{width}}}$ is $\maroonD{2\dfrac12}\text{ cm}$.    [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\maroonD{2\dfrac12}$ as $\maroonD{\dfrac52}$.

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 4 centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two and a half centimeters.

hints.content: The area of the rectangle is $10 \text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: Here is a square:    **Find the area of the square.**   *Hint: All sides in a square have the same length.*   $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters.
A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters.
A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three-fourths meters.

hints.content: The area of the square is $\dfrac{9}{16} \text{ m}^2$.

question.content: Here is a square:    **Find the area of the square.**   *Hint: All sides in a square have the same length.*   $\text{cm}^2$

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled four-ninths centimeters.
A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled four-ninths centimeters.
A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled four-ninths centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled four-ninths centimeters.

hints.content: The area of the square is $\dfrac{16}{81} \text{ cm}^2$.

question.content: Here is a square:    **Find the area of the square.**   *Hint: All sides in a square have the same length.*   $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and two-thirds meters.

hints.content: The ${\maroonD{\text{width}}}$ is $\maroonD{1\dfrac23}\,\text{m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\maroonD{1\dfrac23}$ as $\maroonD{\dfrac53}$.

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and two-thirds meters.

hints.content: The ${\blueE{\text{length}}}$ is $\blueE{1\dfrac23}\,\text{m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\blueE{1\dfrac23}$ as $\blueE{\dfrac53}$.

images.alt: A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and two-thirds meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and two-thirds meters.

hints.content: The area of the square is $\dfrac{25}{9} \text{ m}^2$.  This can also be written as $2\dfrac{7}{9} \text{ m}^2$.

question.content: Here is a square:    **Find the area of the square.**   *Hint: All sides in a square have the same length.*   $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three and a half meters.

hints.content: The ${\maroonD{\text{width}}}$ is $\maroonD{3\dfrac12}\,\text{m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\maroonD{3\dfrac12}$ as $\maroonD{\dfrac72}$.

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three and a half meters.

hints.content: The ${\blueE{\text{length}}}$ is $\blueE{3\dfrac12}\,\text{m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\blueE{3\dfrac12}$ as $\blueE{\dfrac72}$.

images.alt: A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled three and a half meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled three and a half meters.

hints.content: The area of the square is $\dfrac{49}{4} \text{m}^2$.  This can also be written as $12\dfrac{1}{4} \text{m}^2$.

question.content: Here is a square:    **Find the area of the square.**   *Hint: All sides in a square have the same length.*   $\text{m}^2$

images.alt: A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-sevenths meters.
A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-sevenths meters.
A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-sevenths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-sevenths meters.

hints.content: The area of the square is $\dfrac{4}{49} \text{m}^2$.

question.content: **What is the area of a square with $2\dfrac1{2}\text{cm}$ sidelengths?**    $\text{cm}^2$

hints.content: The ${\maroonD{\text{width}}}$ is $\maroonD{2\dfrac12}\,\text{cm}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\maroonD{2\dfrac12}$ as $\maroonD{\dfrac52}$.

images.alt: A square. Its width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two and a-half centimeters.

hints.content: The ${\blueE{\text{length}}}$ is $\blueE{2\dfrac12}\,\text{cm}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\blueE{2\dfrac12}$ as $\blueE{\dfrac52}$.

images.alt: A square. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled two and a half centimeters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled two and a half centimeters.

hints.content: The area of the square is $\dfrac{25}{4}\text{cm}^2$.  This can also be written as $6\dfrac{1}{4}\text{cm}^2$.

question.content: Sammy has a rectangular doormat on her porch. The mat is $\dfrac45\text{ m}$ long and $\dfrac12\text{ m}$ wide.   **What is the area of the doormat?**   $\text{m}^2$

hints.content: Sammy's doormat is a rectangle.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle with unlabeled sides.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled four-fifths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half meters.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled four-fifths meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half meters.

hints.content: The area of the doormat is $\dfrac2{5}\text{ m}^2$.

question.content: A large rectangular parking lot is $\dfrac23\text{ km}$ long and $\dfrac12\text{ km}$ wide.   **What is the area of the parking lot?**   $\text{km}^2$

hints.content: The parking lot is a rectangle.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle with unlabeled sides.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-thirds kilometers. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half kilometers.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled two-thirds kilometers. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one-half kilometers.

hints.content: The area of the parking lot is $\dfrac{1}{3}\text{ km}^2$.

question.content: A rectangular bulletin board is $1\dfrac15\text{ m}$ wide and $2\text{ m}$ long.   **What is the area of the bulletin board?**   $\text{m}^2$

hints.content: The bulletin board is a rectangle.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle with unlabeled sides.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and one-fifth meters.

hints.content: The ${\maroonD{\text{width}}}$ is $\maroonD{1\dfrac15}\,\text{m}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\maroonD{1\dfrac15}$ as $\maroonD{\dfrac65}$.

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and one-fifth meters.

hints.content: The area of the bulletin board is $\dfrac{12}{5}\text{m}^2$.  This can also be written as $2\dfrac2{5}\text{m}^2$.

question.content: A rectangular flying carpet is $1\dfrac12\text{ m}$ wide and $2\text{ m}$ long.   **What is the area of the carpet?**   $\text{m}^2$

hints.content: The carpet is a rectangle.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle with unlabeled sides.
A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and a half meters.

hints.content: The ${\maroonD{\text{width}}}$ is $\maroonD{1\dfrac12}\,\text{m}$.   [[☃ image 1]]  We can rewrite $\maroonD{1\dfrac12}$ as $\maroonD{\dfrac32}$.

images.alt: A rectangle. Its length is marked by a curved bracket labeled 2 meters. The width is marked by a curved bracket labeled one and a half meters.

hints.content: The area of the carpet is $3\text{m}^2$.

question.content: The area of the entire figure below is $1$ square unit.       **What is the area of the striped rectangle?**   *Write your answer as a fraction.*   of a square unit

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 70 parts, set in 7 rows of 10 parts each. The first 9 parts in the top 3 rows are striped to show they are shaded both blue and purple. The tenth parts in the top 3 rows have been shaded blue. The first 9 parts in the bottom 4 rows have been shaded purple. The tenth parts in the bottom 4 rows are unshaded. Along the top of the rectangle, the columns are labeled one-tenth. Along the left side of the rectangle, the rows are labeled one-seventh. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 9 tenths. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled 3 sevenths.

hints.content: To find the area of the shaded rectangle, we multiply the rectangle's ${\purpleE{\text{length}}} \times {\blueE{\text{width}}}$.
The ${\purpleE{\text{length}}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\purpleE{\dfrac9{10}}$ of a unit.  [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 2]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 70 parts, set in 7 rows of 10 parts each. The first nine parts in all 7 rows have been shaded purple. The tenth parts in all rows are unshaded. Along the top of the rectangle, the columns are labeled one-tenth. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled nine tenths.

hints.content: The ${\blueE{\text{width}}}$ is $\blueE{\dfrac37}$ of a unit.   [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 4]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 70 parts, set in 7 rows of 10 parts each. The first ten parts in the top 3 rows have been shaded blue. All ten parts  in the bottom 4 rows are unshaded.  Along the left side of the rectangle, the rows are labeled one-seventh. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled three sevenths.

hints.content: The area of the striped rectangle is $\dfrac{27}{70}$ of a square unit.

question.content: The area of the entire figure below is $1$ square unit.      **What is the area of the striped rectangle?**   *Write your answer as a fraction.*    of a square unit

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 63 parts, set in 7 rows of 9 parts each. The first nine parts in the top 3 rows are striped to show they are shaded both blue and purple. The tenth parts in the top 3 rows have been shaded blue. The first nine parts in the bottom 4 rows have been shaded purple. The tenth parts in the bottom 4 rows are unshaded. Along the top of the rectangle, the columns are labeled one-tenth. Along the left side of the square, the rows are labeled one-seventh. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 4 ninths. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled 5 sevenths.

hints.content: To find the area of the striped rectangle, we multiply the rectangle's ${\blueE{\text{length}}} \times {\purpleE{\text{width}}}$.
The ${\blueE{\text{length}}}$ is $\blueE{\dfrac57}$ of a unit.    [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ explanation 2]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 63 parts, set in 5 rows of 9 parts each. All 9 parts in the top 5 rows have been shaded blue. All 9 parts in the bottom 2 rows are unshaded.  Along the left side of the rectangle, the rows are labeled 1 seventh. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled 5 sevenths.

hints.content: The ${\purpleE{\text{width}}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\purpleE{\dfrac4{9}}$ of a unit.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ explanation 3]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 63 parts, set in 7 rows of 9 parts each. The first 4 parts in all 7 rows have been shaded purple. The fifth through ninth parts in all rows are unshaded. Along the top of the rectangle, the columns are labeled 1 ninth. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 4 ninths.

hints.content: The area of the striped rectangle is $\dfrac{20}{63}$ of a square unit.

question.content: The area of the entire figure below is $1$ square unit.        **What is the area of the striped rectangle?**   *Write your answer as a fraction.*   of a square unit

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 50 parts, set in 5 rows of 10 parts each. The first 7 parts in the top 3 rows are striped to show they are shaded both blue and purple. The last 3 parts in the top 3 rows have been shaded blue. The first 7 parts in the bottom 2 rows have been shaded purple. The last 3 parts in the bottom 2 rows are unshaded. Along the top of the rectangle, the columns are labeled 1 tenth. Along the left side of the rectangle, the rows are labeled 1 fifth. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 3 fifths. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled 7 tenths.

hints.content: To find the area of the striped rectangle, we multiply the rectangle's ${\purpleE{\text{length}}} \times {\blueE{\text{width}}}$.
The ${\purpleE{\text{length}}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\purpleE{\dfrac7{10}}$ of a unit.    [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 50 parts, set in 5 rows of 10 parts each. The first 7 parts in all 5 rows have been shaded purple. The eighth through tenth parts in all rows are unshaded. Along the top of the rectangle, the columns are labeled 1 tenth. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 7 tenths.

hints.content: The ${\blueE{\text{width}}}$ is $\blueE{\dfrac35}$ of a unit.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 50 parts, set in 5 rows of 10 parts each. All 10 parts in the top 3 rows have been shaded blue. All 10 parts in the bottom 2 rows are unshaded.  Along the left side of the rectangle, the rows are labeled 1 fifth. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled 3 fifths.

hints.content: The area of the striped rectangle is $\dfrac{21}{50}$ of a square unit.

question.content: A $3$-unit by $1$-unit rectangle is shown below.      **What is the area of the striped rectangle?**   square units

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 6 parts, set in 2 rows of 3 parts each. All 3 parts in the top row are striped to show they are shaded both blue and purple. All 3 parts in the bottom row have been shaded purple. Along the top of the rectangle, each of the 3 columns are labeled 1. Along the left side of the rectangle, each of the 2 rows are labeled one-half. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 3. A bracket along the top part of the rectangle's width is labeled one-half.

hints.content: To find the area of the striped rectangle, we multiply the rectangle's ${\purpleE{\text{length}}} \times {\blueE{\text{width}}}$.
The $\purpleE{\text{length}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\purpleE{3}$ units.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 6 parts, set in 2 rows of 3 parts each. All parts are shaded purple. Along the top of the rectangle, each of the 3 columns are labeled 1. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 3.

hints.content: The $\blueE{\text{width}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\blueE{\dfrac12}$ of a unit.   [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 2]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 6 parts, set in 2 rows of 3 parts each. All 3 parts in the top row are shaded blue. All 3 parts in the bottom row are unshaded. Along the left side of the rectangle, each of the 2 rows are labeled one-half. A bracket along the rectangle's width is labeled one-half.

hints.content: The area of the striped rectangle is $\dfrac32$ square units.  We can also write this as $1\dfrac12$ square units.

question.content: A $3$-unit by $1$-unit rectangle is shown below.     **What is the area of the shaded rectangle?**   square units

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 15 parts, set in 5 rows of 3 parts each. All 3 parts in the top 3 rows are striped to show they are shaded both blue and purple. All 3 parts in the bottom 2 rows have been shaded purple. Along the top of the rectangle, each of the 3 columns are labeled 1. Along the left side of the rectangle, each of the 5 rows are labeled one-fifth. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 3. A bracket along the top part of the rectangle's width is labeled three-fifths.

hints.content: To find the area of the striped rectangle, we multiply the rectangle's ${\purpleE{\text{length}}} \times {\blueE{\text{width}}}$.
The $\purpleE{\text{length}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\purpleE{3}$ units.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 15 parts, set in 5 rows of 3 parts each. All parts are shaded purple. Along the top of the rectangle, each of the 3 columns are labeled 1. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 3.

hints.content: The $\blueE{\text{width}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\blueE{\dfrac35}$ of a unit.   [[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 15 parts, set in 5 rows of 3 parts each. All 3 parts in the top 3 rows are shaded blue. All 3 parts in the bottom 2 rows are unshaded. Along the left side of the rectangle, each of the 5 rows are labeled one-fifth. A bracket along the top part of the rectangle's width is labeled three-fifths.

hints.content: The area of the shaded rectangle is $\dfrac95$ square units.  We can also write this as $1\dfrac45$ square units.

question.content: A $4$-unit by $1$-unit rectangle is shown below.     **What is the area of the shaded rectangle?**   square units

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 12 parts, set in 3 rows of 4 parts each. All 8 parts in the top 2 rows are striped to show they are shaded both blue and purple. All 4 parts in the bottom row have been shaded purple. Along the top of the rectangle, each of the 4 columns are labeled 1. Along the left side of the rectangle, each of the 2 rows are labeled one-third. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 4. A bracket along the top part of the rectangle's width is labeled two-thirds.

hints.content: To find the area of the shaded rectangle, we multiply the rectangle's ${\purpleE{\text{length}}} \times {\blueE{\text{width}}}$.
The $\purpleE{\text{length}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\purpleE{4}$ units.  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 12 parts, set in 3 rows of 4 parts each. All 12 parts are shaded purple. Along the top of the rectangle, each of the 4 columns are labeled 1. A bracket along the rectangle's length is labeled 4.

hints.content: The $\blueE{\text{width}}$ of the shaded rectangle is $\blueE{\dfrac23}$ of a unit.  [[☃ image 1]]  [[☃ explanation 2]]

images.alt: A rectangle that has been split into 12 parts, set in 3 rows of 4 parts each. All 8 parts in the top 2 rows are shaded blue. All 4 parts in the bottom row are unshaded. Along the left side of the rectangle, each of the 2 rows are labeled one-third. A bracket along the top part of the rectangle's width is labeled two-thirds.

hints.content: The area of the shaded rectangle is $\dfrac83$ square units.  We can also write this as $2\dfrac23$ square units.
